title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: The realm of nebulae : Our Galaxy - external galaxies - our neighborhood â Hubble s law of expansion - mapping the distribution of galaxy. The expanding universe : the cosmological Principle- dynamics of the expanding Universe different cosmological models - space time curvature - cosmological constant. Thermal history of the universe. Current problems in cosmology: dark matter inflation - large-scale structure formation and CMBR anisotropies - the high redshift universe.

title: Concepts taught in class
text:
• Basic Observations - Olbers' Paradox
• Doppler Effect and Redshift (Non Relativistic)
• Hubble's Law
• Friedman equations(The core of Cosmology) are derived and its different cases of it are discussed. (This is the most important thing in the first half of the course)
• Thermal History of the universe A brief discussion on Big Bang to the Present Inflation Cosmic Microwave Background Dark Matter Big Bang Nucleosynthesis Structure Formation

title: Student Opinion
text: Modern Cosmology is generally studied with General Relativity and Quantum Field theory. But this course doesn't require them as pre-requisites. Professor T.S Ray does an amazing job in delivering the ideas without using any GR and QFT. The course can be enjoyed even by students outside of Physics Department.
